Problem Statement: 
 
Design an autonomous vehicle which is capable of following black line on a white surface. 
 
? General Rules: 
 
• The participant must be a regular student of AICTE approved /UGC recognized Technical or 
 
Management Institute. 
 
• All students must have a valid identity card of their respective educational institute. 
 
• Any team that is not ready at the time specified will be eliminated from the competition 
 
automatically. 
 
• The team must adhere to the spirit of healthy competition. Judges reserve the right to disqualify 
 
any team indulged in misbehavior. 
 
• Certificate of excellence will be awarded to all the winners. 
 
• Participants from different institutes may form a team. 
 
• Event rules can be subjected to change. 
 
• Damaging any property (arena/systems) will lead to the disqualification. 
 
• Participants should not have any objection on the predefined rules. 
 
• Judges decision shall be treated as final and binding on all. 
 
•Involvement of a participant in two teams is strictly prohibited, 
 
violating this rule will lead to disqualification of both the teams. 
 
? ROBOT specification and Gameplay:- 
 
•The microcontroller on-board must be an 8-bit microcontroller 
 
• Line will be of 2 cm width. 
 
• There will be numerous breaks in the path(maximum gap-3.5 to 4 cm) The bot has to check the next 
 
available route and follow that. 
 
• Check points are horizontal strip of black lines of length 8/9cm and width 2 cm, the bot has to detect 
 
the strip by glowing led or buzzer. 
 
• The room in which the event will take place will be relatively dark. 
 
• Maximum team size must be 4 members. 
 
• Robots must be autonomous and in case of external power supply the wire must remain slacked all 
 
the time. 
 
• LEGO kits are not allowed, however the participants can use readymade sensors, microcontroller 
 
boards, chassis and programmers. 
 
• Maximum dimensions of the robot should be 25*25*25 cm. 
 
• The power supply for the vehicle cn be on-board/off-board, and should not exceed 15V 
 
• The event consists of two rounds: – Elimination round and the Final round. 
 
• The track will consist of sharp(90 and obtuse turn) as well as smooth turns. 
 
• Nudging/Pushing or any type of manual handling of the robot will lead to cancellation of that run. 
 
• The path will of black colour on a white background. 
 
• The organizers will ensure that the track is located within a typical indoor environment in so far as 
 
is feasible. No request to adjust the lighting shall be entertained.
